radiographic_examinations.findings: The liver demonstrates normal echogenicity. There is no evidence of focal lesions. There is intrahepatic biliary ductal dilatation. The common bile duct is mildly dilated measuring up to 11 mm and contains a 6 mm stone. The gallbladder is mildly distended and contains some sludge, however there is no significant gallbladder wall thickening or pericholecystic fluid. The portal vein is patent. Visualized portions of the pancreas are unremarkable without evidence of focal lesions or pancreatic duct dilatation. An 11 mm nonobstructive stone is seen in the lower pole of the right kidney. There is no hydronephrosis.
